lenders.name: JAMES
lenders.loan_because: The impact that is made is completely life changing for the recipient who simply needs very modest help. If you have not been to a 3W Country you won't understand the profound impact so little brings. To dramatically change their lives and those around them is the most satisfying emotion I have ever felt . It's not a handout. I heard this once and never forgot it.... "Give a man a fish, you feed him for a day. Teach a man how to fish, you feed him for a lifetime".
lenders.occupational_info: I am the General Manager  responsible for day to day oversight for Departments that involve Sales,Training, Supply Chain Mgt., Distribution, Delivery, Installation, and Customer Satisfaction.

lenders.name: Jessica
lenders.loan_because: I want to see others able to achieve the things they want to.  I want to loan to others to help them attain these dreams, just like I have loaned money from others to get me through school in order to achieve mine!
lenders.occupational_info: I'm studying at Penn-State University to become an art educator!

lenders.name: Eva
lenders.loan_because: I believe that microfinance gives people choices, and the chance to improve their lives in small and lovely ways. Every little bit makes a difference!
lenders.occupational_info:
Shared stories as a Kiva Fellow in Cagayan de Oro, Philippines - love to KF9 and my host MFI, Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc.!

Learn more about HSPFI: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=128

Join HSPFI's lending team! http://www.kiva.org/team/hspfi

Lend to a HSPFI borrower! Check out all of HSPFI's fundraising loans here: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&partner_id=128&status=fundRaising&sortBy=New+to+Old

lenders.name: Tien
lenders.loan_because: I want to open small fashion clothes shop.
lenders.occupational_info:
I'm living in Nha Trang city, a medium city of Viet Nam. In my city the people almost is youth. They are business women, students... And I think they need change every month for their fashion clothes. If I have $ 500 I will go to Hochiminh City buy fashion clothes by cheap prices ex: I buy 1 skrit 70 000 VND at Hochiminh City after that I come back my city I will hanger it in my shop nearly crow street, I will sell this one over 120 000 VND easy. But 
now I have only $ 500 so that I need loan $ 500 more for my project. Thank you so much for your support

lenders.name: Cabrillo College
lenders.loan_because: WE believe in the possibility for change. Poverty can be over come and KIVA is a great way to join the efforts and join the community that is reaching out to people all over the world. WE are excited to be here, let's get started and work together. We are looking forward to seeing the power of community through KIVA! In the words of Ben Harper we have to believe that,"[we] can change the world, make it a better place, make it a kinder place, make peace on earth, with [our] own two hands..."
lenders.occupational_info: We are a group of college students who have been inspired by the positive change that KIVA is committed to. Poverty can be overcome and it begins with people standing up and taking action against it. So we are here to join in the efforts and are very excited and thankful for the opportunity to be a part of something big, positive, caring and effective at creating sustainable change. Let's do it!

lenders.name: Melinda
lenders.loan_because:
I believe with Andre Brink (A Dry White Season) "There are only two kinds of madness one must guard against: One is the belief that we can do everything. The other is the belief that we can do nothing."

Or, as a proverb quoted by Dambisa Moyo in her book, "Dead Aid" puts it: "The best time to plant a tree is 20 years ago.  The second best time is now."
lenders.occupational_info: I teach biology and related subjects to high school students.  I also travel to Zambia, every other year, with students from my school.  We work with partner schools in Lusaka, mostly on computer skills training.

lenders.occupational_info: I am unemployed and am looking for work that benefits communities rather than adds to the problems.  For example, I will not work for a fast food restaurant because it promotes gluttony, laziness, and health problems.  I will work for a bookstore because it promotes ideas, knowledge and good will.  These types of jobs are hard to come by in my country.

lenders.occupational_info: I work in a public school library in the United States.  The school has 2000 students in grades 9-12.  I help students select books, research, and evaluate resources. I also work with teachers to teach classes.

Rocky Mount, NC USA

lenders.name: suresh Gandhari
lenders.loan_because: i want to do  business of  musical instrument .which my ans ester had  done . i want  to preserve my cultural  musical instrument.
lenders.occupational_info:
The Gandharba are Nepal’s only traditional musician caste. According to myth, the original Gandharba descended from the heavens to spread local news, music and songs from community to community. In Hindu mythology the Gandharba were once the winged musicians of the Gods. Unfortunately, the Gandharbas belong to a caste that belongs to the "dalit" or “untouchables”- a title given to those born into a role that once left them within the socially and economically downtrodden groups of Nepal. Long before Television and the Radio, they travelled from place to place, playing their lively music and spreading news, making them messengers of the nation. Our ancestors would sing tales with themes ranging from battles and stories of long ago to local gossip, in exchange for a small amount of money or food. We played a significant role in spreading and preserving Nepali culture and folklore. During the unification of Nepal, King Prithivi Narayan Shah utilized the Gandharba people throughout the country to sing in favor of a united kingdom. Gandharbas further played a diplomatic and tactical role in the formation of Nepal as a united kingdom, by facilitating the transfer of information from one region to another, encouraging cooperation between the different districts that were finally uniting. Throughout Nepali History this has been the case, up until the present day, such as seen in the role played by the Gandharbas in the JANA ANDOLAN of 2006/2007.

The recent advances in modern media communication have displaced our traditional roles. Regular employment as a traditional Nepali folk musician is difficult to both find and secure, despite the fact that our music is a cultural treasure. We have little or no land and, due to poverty, many of us have not received an education beyond primary school. In an effort to find musical employment many Gandharbas have migrated to the main tourist areas of Nepal, hoping to sell an occasional Sarangi as a means of inconsistent income. We have our own culture, rituals, traditions and lifestyle, which we strive with the meager funds raised from sale of our musical instruments, or the occasional performances, to maintain in a modern, developing, ever more expensive world.

Relying so heavily on tourism as a source of income, most of the Gandharba living and working in the cities are left homeless and food-less during off-peak tourist seasons. Improved shelter, food, clothing, jobs, health and education are urgently required for this group of people to survive, as well as maintain their identity in this busy world. Still we wander form place to place, trying to make a living. Many of us have migrated from the village to the city with families in toe, looking for employment, better living conditions, and a better quality education for their children. The majority of Gandharbas are illiterate. Job discrimination is common - not a single senior level position in the government is held by a Gadharba. We have been involved in Dalit networks and in several programs involving but we are left out by the Dalit organizatons as well. so i want to so this business.  to get oppertunity and survive in  this expensive  Nepal.

Just as entrepreneurs need access to capital to grow their business, villages need access to clean water in order for everything to run smoothly.

We address this global water crisis by selling eco-friendly reusable steel water bottles, while giving an enormous 50% of the list price to water-related charities.

lenders.name: doug
lenders.loan_because: At age 12 I wanted a paper route, but needed to upgrade my little dirt bike to something that could carry newspapers. After mowing lawns for several months, my Dad helped me over the savings hump with a small loan. I was able to get a sturdier bike, and therefore the paper route, and payed him off within a few months. In a few years, I was able to save enough money for my first car, which I eventually sold to pay for college, etc. A little help goes a long way.
lenders.occupational_info: International Volunteer Professional Placements; I try to connect the skills and hearts of loving people with the goals and needs of those who are ready for advancement.

lenders.name: Drew
lenders.loan_because: I like helping people. And this is a great way to do it.

In México only 1 out of 10 mexicans know how to speak English; having in mind that we are neighbours of the US an Canada, this situation puts us in disadvantage for the near future integration of the zone.
I am shure that this loan can be paid in less than 2 years, please help this dream come true.
lenders.occupational_info: I have been self employed in different kinds of jobs for the last 6 years and I know how difficult is to support your family when you do not have a Bachelors Degree, so now I would like to help people thru my bussines

lenders.occupational_info: I work at a private foundation as an office assitant but my passion has always been dancing. I no longer dance as I once did, as a competitive ballroom dancer, but still teach on occasion.

lenders.name: Vijaya
lenders.loan_because: It is one more way to move the needle towards social change in the world.

lenders.name: Christopher
lenders.loan_because: I really like the idea of loaning money to people that want to start their own businesses.  It allows people to take advantage of opportunities that  might not be available otherwise.  It also promotes economic growth and encourages self-sufficiency.
lenders.occupational_info: I design and write software for computers.

lenders.name: Brittney
lenders.loan_because: I believe empowering women to start their own businesses and become more independent is one of the most important things women who have the means to help others should do.
lenders.occupational_info: I am working towards a degree in feminist counselling, to help women and children who have been in abusive situations move on with their lives in a positive way.
